Articles.Content:
I did a search in the challenge section and didn't see this. If it's been done to death let me know and I'll request the thread closed.

Challenge - Kerbal Stacking

Aim - Stack as many Kerbals as you can vertically.

Rules - Must be a free standing stack. No gravity hacks. Feel free to visit any body you like to complete your entry. If there is enough interest in visiting other bodies and stacking Kerbals I may further categorise the results.

Points - 1 Per Kerbal

Kerbin Leaderboard

1. sweetpezak - 7

2.

3.

4.

5.

Non-Kerbin Leaderboard

1. Speeding Mullet - 3

2.

3.

4.

5.

Edited September 5, 2013 by Speeding Mullet

There should be two categories: Kerbin and non-Kerbin

Stacking on Kerbin would require much more creativity because you wouldn't be able to use the EVA jetpack to just fly to the top of the stack

There should be two categories: Kerbin and non-Kerbin.....

Agreed, great shout. Challenge amended. I could always split the categories further if people are buying in to it.

Edited August 25, 2013 by Speeding Mullet
You should add "no hack gravity" to the rules.

So hopefully this counts as a free-standing stack, they aren't touching the flagpole, 7 Kerbals on Kerbin lol... my original plan didn't work out so well, at about 4 or 5 Kerbals the bottom ones begin rotating and doing weird things:

Getting the gang together for failed attempt:

You should add "no hack gravity" to the rules.

Agreed, it is not in the spirit of the challenge - rules amended.

So hopefully this counts as a free-standing stack, they aren't touching the flagpole

Ladies and Gentlemen, I believe we have our first winner. It looks like you assembled a crowd too which is encouraged, but unfortunately collects no additional points.

7 to beat!

So hopefully this counts as a free-standing stack, they aren't touching the flagpole, 7 Kerbals on Kerbin lol... my original plan didn't work out so well, at about 4 or 5 Kerbals the bottom ones begin rotating and doing weird things:

Getting the gang together for failed attempt:

I saw you try that on the stream lol. That's genius.

-Bob_Kerman

http://i.imgur.com/thj3F.gif
Beat my previous score, updated photo and leader board.
